intro: Crotalaria leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a fibrous root system that helps in nitrogen fixation. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein in some regions.
